Name: So far, so good (and dry)
Author: S. R. Southard
Review Text: I had my first opportunity to use the umbrella today. It worked well, and held up to a stiff wind, too. However, it's probably silly to rate an umbrella after one day's use. They all work on the first day. I suppose the extra (9th) rib helps it stand up to wind, but it also provides an additional point of potential failure as the umbrella ages. I'm used to buying umbrellas at the nearest drug store. They last a few years, then fail, either by leaking or more likely by a broken rib or broken shaft detent. I like umbrellas that collapse into a small package I can fit inside my briefcase. This is the first umbrella I bought on Amazon. As I say, so far, so good. However, I may update this review someday if the umbrella fails earlier than it should have.

Name: Not really a lifetime warranty...
Author: Rico
Review Text: I bought this umbrella a few months ago and unfortunately, it broke while it was windy out. I think "windproof" is a bit much because it was pretty windy but the umbrella still broke. I emailed them and they refunded the purchase but never sent a new one. I emailed them about this and got no response so I ordered another and asked for a refund on the purchase and they said this one would have to break before I can get a refund, which just seems convoluted. Overall, the umbrella is nice but worth $20 at most and neither the handle nor circumference is very big. When its windy and rainy, you need something a little bigger or it'll go right around the umbrella and if you're wearing a backpack, you can expect it to be soaked. I would've been happy to have purchased it if their customer service was better about replacing a broken umbrella when asked instead of making me jump through the hoops.

Name: "THIS IS THE ONLY UMBRELLA YOU SHOULD EVER PURCHASE...IT IS A "MUST-HAVE!"
Author: On The Fly
Review Text: First of all: I have no financial interest in this company nor have I received any incentive to write this review.  This umbrella is "The Best of The Best!"for the following reasons:1. The frame is strong.2. The handle is strong.3. The open/close mechanism is easy to operate; reaction is swift: when opening and closing.4. THE FABRIC IS THICK AND REPELS WATER INSTANTLY. Also: The fabric is attached to the frame with strong thread and the stitching is secure.5. The size is perfect to stow in a purse, briefcase, backpack, etc.6. EXCELLENT QUALITY AND AFFORDABLE PRICE.7. The stowage sleeve is convenient and made of the same excellent Teflon fabric.

Name: Most good quality umbrellas can't stand up to winds 20 mph
Author: Linann
Review Text: I work in New Haven CT, and in the fall, and winter the wind comes right off the water, so I'm always in the market for an umbrella that will last for a couple of years. I learned from experience, that there is no such thing as an umbrella that can stand up to 50 mph. Most good quality umbrellas can't stand up to winds 20 mph. What I'm looking for is a strong auto open/close, and can stand up to heavy rains. This umbrella is very good quality, with a strong open/close button. I will update when needed, as of now I'm very happy with my purchase. Update: 6/11/18. I've used this a few times now, and the inside is starting to rust. I have never had an umbrella do this.

Name: Decent umbrella compromised by poor-quality rivets
Author: Edward Ripley-Duggan
Review Text: The umbrella appears to be robust; I used it recently during rain and gusty winds in New York with no problems. However, though the ribs seem largely rustproof, I am disappointed to see visible rusting at a couple of the rivets where sections of the ribs are joined, in one case offsetting to the fabric of the umbrella. It makes no sense to me to construct a good frame from rust-resistant materials only to sacrifice that quality with cheap rivets. I‰Ûªm disappointed, though I‰Ûªll keep this.

Name: it is still like new. Great construction
Author: MC Oddslice
Review Text: Update: Too small! If there is wind, you will get wet. It kept my head and upper torso dry when I angled it toward the wind. After several months of use, it is still like new. Great construction. The automatic open and close still works, but if there is wind this is a child's umbrella, and you'd be better off with a rain coat, poncho, or bigger umbrella.I did NOT receive a discount for my opinion. This review is based on my initial impressions after receiving the product and nothing more.Packaging: Inside the shipping box, the umbrella did not come in a box of it's own. It was in a plastic sheathe that was slightly too short to encase the handle. The handle was protected by bubble wrap with a rubber band to hold it securely in place.Build: It was exactly as pictured. I expected the handle to be softer, like a gel, but it is a hard plastic with a rubber like surface for improved grip. The build looks sturdy, though I am a little concerned that bottom rod and top rods have a little bit of rotational wiggle. Also, there were some spare loose threads on the end of one of the spokes where it had been tied off. I expected to be able to feel some type of coating, but the fabric feels really thin, and I couldn't see or feel any difference.Functionality: BEWARE! When you first receive it the button may have been pressed already. I unwrapped the strap, and the umbrella sprang out immediately! Be sure you don't have it aimed at anyone, yourself included! I pressed the button, and it sprang closed. It did take some strength to push it back in. It may be difficult for children and some adults. The average person won't have a problem with it. I closed it and opened it 4 or 5 times. It performed consistently and flawlessly.Final Thoughts: It seems to be sturdy, and it opens and closes as it should. For $50.00 I'd like to have seen a gel handle on it, but it was on sale for $20.95, and didn't advertise a gel handle, so I can't take any points away for not being as advertised. We don't get much wind here in Missouri, but the price was right for having a lifetime warranty. I will update this rating after I've tried it in the rain, and or if the open/close mechanism fails.

Name: For a tiny person
Author: AR
Review Text: I was excited to try out this umbrella based on its many reviews. However, once I received it, I was not impressed. The shaft of the umbrella was not very long so that meant that if I held this umbrella normally there would not be a lot of space between the top of my head and the top of this umbrella. And who wants to hold an umbrella super close like you're hugging it?Also, the width of the canopy was not great at all. It just barely covered most of my shoulders. Had I used this in actual rain, I'm pretty sure my shoulders and arms and back would've been soaked from lack of coverage.The construction of the umbrella distracted me from examining the quality of the material used. But I will say it didn't strike me as being heavy duty or anything.As I previously stated, overall I wasn't impressed with this product. I have returned it for a refund and a different product by a different brand and seller.

Name: Decent, a bit pricey?
Author: Alex Wang
Review Text: This umbrella is pretty good. never had a umbrella with fiberglass before so it felt like plastic to me (if thats how fiberglass is suppose to feel like then cool). I cant say how good this works with high winds cause i haven't had any, but so far it feels sturdy. The only thing i do not like is the opening and closing mechanism. Mine does not open 100% after pressing the button 100% of the time. The times it doesn't it opens more like 90-95%. And it is a bit expensive at 22 a pop

Name: Not consistent with reviews or description.
Author: Hannah
Review Text: I must have received a bad item or something because it's nothing like what the reviews or description made it out to be. Two stars only for the functioning open and close button and it holds up fairly well against the wind. Other than that, it's really wobbly, not water repellant at all, broke after about five uses. I am so disappointed in paying so much for an umbrella that pretty much doesn't live up to the description when I could have paid half for one that would last me longer. The ribs are starting to come undone from the string that attaches it to the umbrella. Wonder how long before al the other ribs start doing the same. I would be really weary about purchasing.

Name: Seems well-built and well-designed.
Author: Terende
Review Text: I bought two of these for my and my spouse's upcoming trip to the UK, where we'll most likely need something reliable and sturdy.  It's heavier, at close to a pound, than most cheaper compact umbrellas, but if that means it's built better (and it looks solid) it's worth it.  Pressing the open/close button causes it to spring open like a Batman utensil, so you'd better be clear of obstructions and/or fragile humans.  Pressing the button again causes the canopy to rapidly collapse, although it doesn't retract down the shaft back to the handle.  You have to push down from the top center of the canopy, where there is a hard disk for that purpose, until it clicks into place.  The pleats retain their shape so that you can easily re-store the umbrella back into the carrying sleeve looking like it did when first opened.  I won't know how it will hold up until we start our vacation, but will post an update if there are any problems.

Name: Good Quality but Nearly Useless - Umbrella for Little People - Like Walking with a Daiquiri Garnish
Author: Robert S. Blackie
Review Text: I cannot argue with the fact that this umbrella is of superb quality (which is the reason for my giving it 2 stars instead of 1), but the size is so small as to render it nearly useless for anyone over 5' tall (I am 5'10" - hardly a giant). I had the opportunity to try out my new umbrella today in a steady rain with no wind, and after a 15 minute walk home I was wet from the chest down and my very small backpack was drenched. It's like walking with a strawberry daiquiri garnish, but at least those umbrellas come with a delicious alcoholic beverage. I had to walk intentionally slow just to keep the top third of my body dry. If I didn't live in Mexico I would return it, but from here it just wouldn't be worth the hassle. Now I see why the product listing doesn't indicate the size of the arc - just the length and weight. I'll give this to my 4'11" sister when she comes to visit this month and buy another, larger one with the arc width clearly indicated. EXTREMELY disappointed.

Name: ... have to say this one is by far my favorite. It keeps me dry and has never inverted ...
Author: IJ
Review Text: I've owned at least 50 umbrellas (some bought off the street from a vendor or designer ones) in my lifetime and have to say this one is by far my favorite. It keeps me dry and has never inverted due to the wind (pet peeve). Want to know something else about this umbrella? The company that sells it is amazing with its customer service and lifetime warranty policy. The button started to not work as well (sometimes have to press it 2-3 times before it reacts) so I reached out to the company. Not only did they respond in record lightening speed time, the company sent out a replacement. This all happened in 12 hours!? Highly recommend this umbrella. I rarely give out 5 stars for anything but have to say between the quality of the umbrella and the customer service/lifetime guarantee, you can't go wrong.

Name: classy cute umbrella
Author: lawAbidingCitizen
Review Text: I have benkii before(less1 year) but i lost it :(this is the replacement i chose since it has lifetime warranty without needing to send the umbrella itself back (no need to ship the item if broken)and I expect no less on that promise :)pros: -feels more durable than other  small umbrella, you can notice it by the weight itself and the sturdiness of the main steel -teflon coated so it will dry very fast on rain -ribs feels like bendable durable material so it will survive sudden winds -very handy, fits on small bag -very classy look -lifetime warranty without needing to ship the item back!! (if it broke within a  year i might try this, with screen shot and video record)cons: -i thought the fabric would be a lot thicker since its teflon coated, not an issue though :) -the spring when opening is not super strong but its my preference only, i like it to be more stronger faster opennote: the cons is base on my preference because i have benkii before and as of  now my bag is small so I chose the top umbrella which i think this is :D kudos to the repel team!

Name: Well made product, excellent vendor
Author: sherm624
Review Text: Change from 2 to 5 stars.  After a not-so-great impression, I sent a message to the seller who promptly asked if I wanted a refund or replacement.  Needing an umbrella I asked for a replacement.  It arrived quickly and at no cost.  One of my original issues was that the button to open requires far too much effort, so does closing it.  This is still true, but I've come to realize the product (including this part) is well made.My first time using it was during a rainstorm with 50 mph gusts.  I walked 3 blocks from my work to a parking garage.  The umbrella inverted twice.  After that it did not open automatically (popped up but required manual pushing to lock in place.  I am grateful for the free replacement.

Name: This one goes to 9...
Author: Mergatroid
Review Text: Nicely built. The metal shaft is black however, not chrome. Ribs have composite plastic components as well as metal. Easy to hold grip. Powerful spring to fully open and partially close. A little smaller profile in "diameter" and height than I expected when I first opened it, but it makes it easy to negotiate into and out of a vehicle with the smaller canopy during a downpour (disclaimer: downpour in Southern California). Overall, this is a quality built, lightweight umbrella. Comes with easy on / easy off cover. My last umbrella was nearly 30 years old, and I'm guessing I paid $10 or $12 for it, so the Repel at $24 seems like a good value. I always open mine indoors and let it dry before stowing, so we'll see how it lasts.

Name: support
Author: Robert J. Moser
Review Text: I am a 67 year old banker, been banking for over 45 years. I have owned lots of umbrellas over those years. This is the worst umbrella I have ever used. I got it as a Christmas present and used it for the first (and only) time today. It broke on the first use. It is too late to be returned so I will throw it in the trash where it belongsUpdate the seller has agreed to refund the purchase price in the interest of customer support. That action is one of product confidence, unfortunately mine didn't work but many other reviewers were happy.

Name: Excellent umbrella- would definitely recommend
Author: G Tan
Review Text: I like bullet points, thus: + Excellent build construction - does not feel flimsy or cheap. Has held up well against strong winds/downpours. + The small form factor is convenient and makes it easy to carry around. + The quick open/close function helps keep you dry (especially when attempting to enter a vehicle). + Lifetime guarantee is reassuring. That having been said, I can't speak upon their customer service because my umbrella hasn't had any issues. - Mildly more expensiveI believe this umbrella represents a great value. Great construction and I really like the quick open/close feature. It's a touch more expensive, but the build quality and lifetime guarantee easily justify it for me.My only complaint is that I wish it was bigger/ I had gotten a bigger version (which would kind of defeat its compact form factor). This umbrella works very well for an individual, but it is a bit difficult to keep two people dry if it is raining very hard.All in all, an amazing umbrella that I would definitely recommend.

Name: Umbrella has lots of good features
Author: Lori C.
Review Text: 3rd party seller very involved, customer service communicated with me right away to make sure order and delivery went well and offered discount for next purchase. Umbrella has a lot of good features: appears very sturdy with prongs very reinforced with easy arrow triggers to put umbrella up and retract. However, to get it back to original full down position (pulling it toward the handle), I needed two hands to get it down. Due to the strong nature of perhaps those prongs, it is a bit heavy in weight than other umbrellas this size. The sure grip handle is nice, especially when wet. Hoping not to leave this one anywhere (why I bought the compact size to throw in my purse and not on floor).

Name: NOT "super light" or lightweight. Misleading product description.
Author: JulieT
Review Text: I was looking for a lightweight umbrella to replace my stolen Davek Mini. This one looks sturdy, and certainly could last a few heavy rains, but is NOT lightweight at all and not compact compared to all the other umbrellas that I have purchased so far. The handle is heavy, and it is too big for my regular purse. Well, since I live abroad and cannot return it (I would if I could!), I will keep it as a replacement umbrella in my car, but I am upset by such a misleading description. Will not buy again from this seller.EDIT: got a refund for this item.

Name: Nope nope nope
Author: BillyP
Review Text: I moved to San Francisco and needed an umbrella since it rained there 60% of the time. The second time I used this umbrella it was in medium rainfall with heavy winds. Within a few minutes of stepping outside the house the wind overturned my umbrella and it was a struggle to fix it while I was walking in the rain. Once that was done, I decided to put the umbrella in my backpack and use my hood instead, which frankly was so much better. I wouldn‰Ûªt recommend this umbrella as it can not withstand heavy winds.

Name: Not what I had hoped....
Author: Krysrox413
Review Text: For all the money I paid for this umbrella, I'm incredibly disappointed that after TWO uses, the inner metal is rusting! I left it open, (not fully, since it would be in the way in my small home), but it took an eternity to dry out and when it finally had, I noticed the rust! I expected a much better quality at the cost I paid. Also, the inside has plastic parts! I was purchasing this for it's "windproof" ability. I guess they meant a light breeze. In real weather, this isn't the go-to. Of course, I bought it in preparation of the bad weather, and am past my return period. Oh well. Live and learn.

Name: Nice while it lasted
Author: Ben Perkins
Review Text: It's ok, the build quality seemed nice at first, it's certainly not flimsy and it can hold up to strong winds. However, after only using it a few times, the hinges that hold the fabric are starting to rust and I can no longer collapse it without significant effort (it appears the outer metal tube of the handle is getting jammed on the inner one when I push it to lock). If it doesn't collapse all the way, it can't be re-opened, so I'm always worried that it won't close and I'll be left without an umbrella. Considering I've only used it about 6 times, I'm very disappointed.

Name: Stands up to tough weather
Author: Alexandria
Review Text: I live in Chicago suburbia so I have very little tolerance for subpar coats, boots, umbrellas, etc. We really need our weather-related items to work as hard as we do!I am very pleased with this umbrella because not only does it shield me from precipitation, but it is also made to withstand strong winds.Certainly, every product has its limit, and I'm sure if you simulated a strong enough wind gust perhaps you could make this umbrella turn inside out. However it would take a storm that is newsworthy even in these parts, as in you may hear the tornado sirens. 99% of the time this umbrella will be more than sufficient and it is competitively priced, so I'm very satisfied.I especially appreciate the frame. The "bones" of the umbrella are not like a typical umbrella, and I believe the product description mentions that they are made differently.

Name: Great size.
Author: Seaside Sarah
Review Text: For a compact umbrella, it's a "big" umbrella with great coverage.  It opens in a snap, closes almost as easily.  I bought it for an upcoming trip but will no doubt continue to use it as my mobile umbrella (keep in the car).  Only negatives were it's weight (a bit hefty for travel), and the instructions tell you to push the red button to open/close.  There is no "red" button, it's a black button but clearly marked with white up and down arrows, so was not a big issue.  The warranty is exceptional, never seen one like it on an umbrella at this price.

Name: Can withstand powerful wind
Author: Zavage
Review Text: Being a bachelor, I never really felt the need to own an umbrella since I could just wear a hooded jacket if necessary. Reality hit me in the face real quick when it stormed intensely one day as I was walking across campus. It was miserable as you could guess. So of course, I decided to finally get my first umbrella and ran across this beaut. I have absolutely no complaints for it: it's simple and black as it should be, it opens up very easily, and has so far been able to resist powerful winds. I'll be using this for as long as I possibly can when needed.

Name: Great product and customer service
Author: M.G.M.
Review Text: The umbrella feels sturdy. Haven't experienced any significant wind gust to test the tolerance of the umbrella. The only negative about the umbrella is the rust that is starting to develop around the aluminum rib cages.2/11/17 - Tested the umbrella under strong wind conditions and the umbrella held up extremely well. The umbrella did flip over once, however, no damage to the aluminum frame. Purchased another umbrella today as a gift.1/6/17Edit - upgraded item from 3 stars to 5 stars. Rebecca from customer service reached out to me in regards to the defective product after the warranty had expired. 2 options: replacement or refund. This is my go to umbrella so a replacement was the only alternative. As an added bonus, I get to keep my original umbrella.Thank you Upper Echelon Products!

Name: Has potential - top piece unreliable
Author: Kevin Lee
Review Text: **Update: I'm updating my review from 2 to 4 stars as the company was insanely fast with reaching out to me and getting me a replacement umbrella. I've used the new one twice and so far so good - as I mentioned before, the construction is sturdy but only time will tell if it stays that way. However, would recommend buying this umbrella based on their customer service alone.The ONE time I got to use the umbrella I could tell that the canopy and spokes were pretty sturdy. However, as a couple of other reviews have mentioned, the top piece is either very loose or not constructed well. The second time I went to grab it, I noticed the top piece had disappeared and was nowhere to be found. This causes rain to get into the umbrella...which sort of defeats the whole purpose of having an umbrella. I've owned at least 15 different umbrellas in my life and not one (yes, not even the $5 umbrellas you get from the guys selling on the street when it's raining) has lost the top piece. In fact, I didn't even know it was a removable piece until I found it missing on this one. If the top piece was constructed better, this umbrella would be worth a much higher rating.

Name: well-made umbrella
Author: Mitch
Review Text: I ordered this during a rainstorm and since it arrived, I haven't had a chance to use it outside yet.  So this is a review based on my initial impressions.  I'd been alternating between 2 very old umbrellas that have been in horrible shape for years.  When I saw this on sale and read the reviews, I decided to treat myself to one.  So far I'm impressed.  It feels very durable.  It is beautifully and thoughtfully designed.  For example, the handle has a nice texture that makes it easy to grip.  And the handle is not round, it's oval, so it fits very comfortably in my hand.  I prefer it's fabric wrist strap to the plastic straps on my old umbrellas.  Time will tell how well it holds up with use during winter and spring rains, which I hope are forthcoming!  It's a little heavier than each of my old umbrellas, and I consider that a good sign.  I'm happy with my purchase so far.

Name: Good value!
Author: Clifford Carroll
Review Text: This umbrella is of better apparent quality than any other similar umbrella I have owned before. I have not owned it long enough to discover how durable it is. Examination of the mechanism that opens it reveals that it is way more intricate than others I have owned.  Interestingly, there is no catch to keep it open once it is deployed, but the springs have sufficient tension to keep it open. If I encounter a windy day strong enough to collapse it, then I will not be happy. As Repel states that I now have a "lifetime" warranty, I am not concerned about quality. Assuming, of course, Repel is even still in business once this thing wears out.  Since I live where rain is not very common, it will take years for me to wear it out. For now, I am happy!

Name: Sturdy and Well-Constructed
Author: Justin Paul
Review Text: Feels sturdy and a well constructed umbrella. I find that the handle is a little too short to grip, but that is fair as any increase in length of the handle would make the umbrella's overall length longer. Doesn't feel like a flimsy umbrella in any way.Edit: I have had this umbrella for slightly more than half a year now. Having used it for both rain and shine, I have noticed several weak points.‰ÔÊThe strings holding the ribs are mostly loose by now, distorting the umbrella making it worse at handling gusts.‰ÔÁThe joints at the ribs and shaft are starting to show signs of rusts, the rusts also stains the underside of the canopy‰Ô¢There was a round cap on top of the umbrella, which is brittle. It broke off and so did the flower shaped design. (Purely aesthetics)I hope it'll last another year or so. I'll update if I have more information to share.

Name: Eh...
Author: Marie
Review Text: First of all, this umbrella really does hold its own against strong winds. It won't turn inside-out on you.Unfortunately, mine has broken down for non-wind reasons despite minimal use. I've only used the umbrella a few times, and at least two different ribs have snapped where the last segment should connect. So instead of a nice uninterrupted dome shape, there are a few areas on the umbrella where a rib goes limp and the fabric sags unattractively - and sometimes spills rainwater unexpectedly.I don't know that I would recommend this item. I'm pretty disappointed after investing in a "nice" umbrella for a change.

Name: Broke upon second use/ replaced immediately, great customer service
Author: joe benkert
Review Text: The second time I used this umbrella it opened with such force that it shot out of my hand and broke.After initial review I was contacted by the manufacturer via email.  And was informed that they were happy to replace my product immediately.

Name: Great folding umbrella, easy to use.  Stands up to Texas Thunderstorms.
Author: Kindle Customer
Review Text: I received this Repel Windproof Travel Umbrella at the perfect time with several days of summer thunderstorms for testing.  The easy open and close is a great feature and rain water shakes off very easily.  The easy close is maybe my favorite feature, this is usually when I get soaked closing the umbrella while closing the car door but with the Repel Windproof Travel Umbrella I can have the door cracked just a bit and use the auto close feature and recover the umbrella leaving my dry.  Even with gusty winds the umbrella stayed firmly open with no blow back when several other around me had failures with their umbrella s of several types.

Name: So far, so great.
Author: Joe
Review Text: One week after delivery, it began raining -- and this has proved itself to be a good purchase.  The auto open/close is quick and easy, the waterproofed fabric leaves very little to shake off.  The size is typical for small umbrellas, so you're dealing with the pro-con of carrying a nice, small collapsible vs. a huge, long (with extra-wide coverage) umbrella.  All in all, I'm quite happy.The closing function collapses the open umbrella; you still need to push the stem together to lock it closed / reload for auto opening.  The spring is quite stiff -- making opening very quick, but also requiring a bit of effort to close / reset.  No complaints! ...but the stiff spring makes me wonder about the longevity: how long will it last.  For the great price, though, if it lasts a year it's been a good purchase.

Name: A fantastic umbrella - good looking, sturdy, and compact
Author: SM
Review Text: It might as well be the nicest umbrella we have ever owned! Seriously this is a very well-made umbrella which was actually designed with some milestones/goals in mind and the build quality is undoubtedly better that anything I have seen in my entire life. I bet that there are fancier or sturdier or more expensive ones out there, but by far, this comes across as a really trustworthy umbrella if there is such a thing! I strongly encourage others to try it out for a little more $$ than your average Walmart stuff.

Name: I finally got a chance to use this umbrella and ...
Author: K Hu
Review Text: I finally got a chance to use this umbrella and it broke the first time I used it. The canvas got detached from the one of the metal stickers the time I opened it. Very DISAPPOINTING. Also, unfortunately, I didn't get a chance to try it out the first month I bought it, I've no idea how to deal with this now.Update:The customer service is really really good. Within 24 hours after my previous review, their customer support specialist got back to me ordered a free replacement of the umbrella and now I got a new one and this one works pretty good so far. Nothing is better than a responsive and caring customer service, 5 star!

Name: *UPDATE: Great Customer Service!
Author: IC
Review Text: *UPDATE 3/12/2017* Upper Echelon reached out to me and offered a refund for the purchase of the umbrella. Great customer service, clearly this company cares about customer satisfaction! I will not hesitate to consider Upper Echelon for any future products I am in the market for that can be supplied by them.--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------The umbrella is very hard to close, takes a certain angle and more-than-expected amount of force to close the umbrella and lock it into place. The umbrella is also much smaller than I would have liked. With that said, it does well in poor weather.

Name: Sturdy looking umbrella, speedy open
Author: G. Nair
Review Text: Looks sturdy and open close is swift and strong (good spring). Make sure you don't point it at anyone when opening. It can pack a punch. Had it a week, seems sturdy and will update if it flips during a gust.Lost one star because when I first opened it, two of the ribs appeared stuck to each other. After debating for a bit if that was a wind management feature or not, looked more closely and seemed like when it was last closed in factory, the two rib joints may have come too close and one of the metal strands looped on another and had to be separated. So hoping it does not happen again because the speed with which the umbrella shoots open may cause the fabric to rip if stressed by ribs being stuck.

Name: Nice, but annoying
Author: JZ1
Review Text: UPDATE:  They immediately emailed me apologizing for the umbrella not meeting my full expectations. They offered a full refund or a replacement.  I declined both options because the umbrella wasn't broken and a replacement would have the same issue.  They issued a refund anyway with their apologies  Needless to say, this company truly stands behind their products.  If only all companies were like this one.Nice but annoying.  I like the automatic open/close feature but it's a pain when you only want to close it temporarily.  It won't stay up unless you completely compress it to its original position which is a little difficult if you're carrying other things.

Name: I love this little umbrella
Author: An Avid Reader
Review Text: I love this little umbrella. If you only purchase one umbrella, it should be this one. Folds up small, is compact enough to fit in a purse or car door, functions smoothly and has a decent sized dome. It's not as huge as the last one I had, but the last one I had didn't fold up small so I left it in the car half of the time... it does me no good there! I have had no issues with rust or water damage and have been using it in Florida where it rains nearly every day in the summer months. Great purchase!I will be buying another in the future as a spare or gift it to someone!

Name: Very Good Umbrella and Repels Water like crazy!
Author: Eric G.
Review Text: This umbrella is awesome, albeit a tad bit too small for me (I'm around 6'2", so I need a little more coverage).  The repel feature is great, and only takes a couple of shakes to get most of the water off of it.  It doesn't soak in water either, so when it's time to put it up, I give it a couple of shakes and I'm good to go.  It's very compact, and fits in the side of my backpack (a swiss gear) easily with room to spare.  I've had it for about 4 months, and have taken it with me on a trip to Hong Kong, and it has held up very well.  I would definitely get another one if I need it.

Name: Worked Great for a While.
Author: Marcos
Review Text: Worked Great for a While. Then it started sticking either open or closed. It's pretty hard to operate. It comes with a lifetime warranty so I contacted the Seller. The first time they promised to send a new one but never did. The second time they said they would send it right out but they never did. Promises, promises...

Name: Useless in any wind
Author: Abbey
Review Text: I very rarely write reviews, but I felt this deserved one.  The first time I used this umbrella, it flipped inside out within thirty seconds of opening it, rendering it useless for its intended purpose. I was drenched, and very unhappy.  Will be returning (another thing I very rarely do).

Name: Water leaked through the fabric!
Author: Drummer52895
Review Text: I bought this umbrella because it was the highest rated umbrella on Amazon. In a moderate rain storm the water actually leaked through the fabric material! I was shocked to look up and see water coming through part of the umbrella. The fabric seemed to be porous, there was no gaping hole or other defect.Also, moderate wind was able to flip this umbrella. It did not destroy the umbrella but it did flip. Not windproof, although it does seem more rigid than most umbrellas.

Name: Best Travel Umbrella!
Author: Jonathan B.
Review Text: Bought this on some advice of a friend before an extended trip overseas to Taiwan. I took this through night markets, up the side of Yanmi Mountain, down to the coast in Yilan and everywhere in between. Also had a chance to use it multiple times in the Texas rainstorms on returning home. I personally think this is the best travel umbrella I have ever owned, and I now use it more than my larger ones because it is more convenient. Docked one star for the handle length. If you are a really tall person, like me, the shortness of the handle and smaller diameter of the actual umbrella takes some getting used to if you are carrying a full backpack during a downpour. I would recommend this to friends and purchase again.

Name: Get one of these...you won't regret it!
Author: WhiteBeard
Review Text: Where was this excellent umbrella last time that I was in NYC and saw over 100 broken/discarded umbrellas stuffed into trash cans.  This little fellow would have beat the wind and would have survived.  I used it yesterday for the first time in Denver and it opened like magic, handled the weather nicely, and I'll be darned if it didn't close per the advertisement.  Wow!  Get one...it's super!

Name: I was a bit disappointed in the quality of the shaft/handle
Author: Cheri Z
Review Text: While this umbrella does it's job and dries quickly, I was a bit disappointed in the quality of the shaft/handle.  I believe that will be the weak point of this umbrella.  Also, the button to open/close umbrella is a bit hard to push.  It is still a nice umbrella, but for the price, I expected it to be more substantial.UPDATE:  I want to update this review to reflect the wonderful customer service I received from this company.  While I did not ask for it, they were quick to issue me a refund for this item which Amazon did promptly!  I would deal with this company again if for nothing more than their awesome customer service!

Name: Decent but not as wind proof as advertised
Author: MmmmDonuts
Review Text: I‰Ûªm torn on how to rate this umbrella. I‰Ûªve used this umbrella for the last 5 months in quite a few Florida rainstorms with no problem, until a recent storm with some higher than average wind (not heavy tropical storm winds, but not a light breeze). During that storm, the umbrella blew inside out multiple times leaving me completely soaked. I have not experienced any rust or broken umbrella ribs so far. Overall, it‰Ûªs better than lugging a golf umbrella everywhere because it‰Ûªs fairly lightweight and fits in my large handbags.Pros: sturdier than a normal compact-ish umbrella, fairly lightweight, coverage size good for compact-ish umbrella.Cons: not as wind proof as advertised, not small to medium handbag friendly size.

Name: Sleek and powerful little umbrella
Author: Denny Fanelli
Review Text: Didn't think this little umbrella was going to be such amazing gadget. I like the color, all black. Like that it's versatile. Most of all, I like it's craftsmanship. It's very well made, the ribs and the tube feel like solid material. The most surprising of all is its spring loaded opening with the touch of a button. It's pretty dope fam! Also halfway closes it with the same button. Overall really cool. I keep it in my car, still haven't got to use it, but had to get one cause I accidentally left my old one at my friend's house who lives real far from me.

Name: Worst time of the year is during the monsoon season ...
Author: Mr Chiu Ching Siang
Review Text: We live in this part of the world where we often experience afternoon violent thunderstorms. Worst time of the year is during the monsoon season which usually falls at this time of the year. Finally, we are able to put to test out our new REPEL umbrellas under actual strong wind conditions and thunderstorm rains. We must say REPEL umbrellas passed the extreme wind and water tests with flying colours and to our amazement. So far this is the best umbrella we have bought as compared to average or poorly made umbrellas available in our local market. It's worth the money to pay more for a better quality REPEL umbrellas that we have to order all the way from USA. Certainly the quality of REPEL umbrellas and what it has said out to perform has exceeded our expectations and we won't hesitate to recommend them to our friends in Malaysia.

Name: 1-Year Later; Still functioning, cap on top popped off.
Author: AA
Review Text: I bought this about a year ago but didn't use it for more than a couple of weeks total.It still works just fine, but the umbrella itself isn't any more "windproof" than generic packable umbrellas from my school's gift store. The metallic part that extends feels very flimsy and sways with strong winds too easily. Not at all rigid as I expected.As long as it works (which it does) then I'm happy, but my biggest gripe is the top part of the umbrella just fell off one day. Again, I don't use this umbrella often. It's been in a wardrobe for the majority of the past year until Spring weather came along.I don't get why this is advertised as very durable. Had to deduct 3 stars for advertising an average umbrella as some miracle umbrella.

Name: Second purchase of this great umbrella
Author: Michael A. Smith
Review Text: Great product.  Nice solid feel and sheds rain and wind very nicely. This is my second purchase of this umbrella. Highly recommended.What I am even more impressed by is the vendor's outstanding customer service. The second umbrella developed an issued after purchase where the auto-close feature stopped working. I contacted the company and they are sending me out a free replacement without me having to pack up the problem umbrella and return it. I wish more vendors operated in this fashion. I will definitely be purchasing from this company in the future.

Name: This is by far my favorite travel umbrella
Author: David Bryant
Review Text: This is by far my favorite travel umbrella. It's compact and easily packed in carry on, backpack, or suitcase, is easy to both open and close with one hand, and has held up well in heavy wind and driving rain on many, many trips.  I own several so that I always have one hand as I seem to keep leaving them in the backseat of my car, and (on at least one occasion) a taxi cab in Taipei.  (Oh, and it's reasonably priced, too.)

Name: nice umbrella, good service
Author: S
Review Text: update:The seller contacted me with options to resolve my issue citing reasons some umbrellas may not work optimally. They resolved my issue. Customer service was excellent.It opens firmly but requires energy to close. It's workable but I prefer ones that are easier to close. Otherwise seems fine.second update:Bought another one and this one closes easier. I guess it's a matter of how they're adjusted.

Name: Best Umbrella I've Ever Had
Author: Magic Jeannie
Review Text: Delivered as promised in appropriate packaging. These umbrellas are the sturdiest, best-made we've ever had!  And with nine ribs instead of the usual 6 to 8, they're larger too but not so large as to be unwieldy. They snap open and closed at a touch, and the sleeve fits well over the closed umbrella.  We haven't had a chance to use them yet, but if they work as well as they're made, they should be great.  Will update after we use them.

Name: Best compact umbrella I've bought
Author: Jimmy D
Review Text: Works better than I had expected. Had a recent rain storm come by, it survived the same type of gusts and winds that destroyed my last umbrella. It's light and compact, so carrying it around isn't cumbersome. It's strong and study, despite how light it feels.The coating works as advertised. It absorbs no water, so it dries near instantly. Press the button to collapse, one shake, and the entire thing was 99% dry. By the time I got from the front doors of my building to my office, it was entirely dry. I could close it up and stash it away without worry. Co-workers thought it had stopped raining. Going back to my car, I didn't have to worry about excess water being absorbed and getting that lovely mildew smell.I'd definitely recommend buying this one umbrella, as opposed to what I used to do and buy the cheapo $5-10 ones that break after a light gust.

Name: Buy It!
Author: Janice B.
Review Text: My husband asked for a Totes umbrella. He tends to become brand loyal, which isn't always bad, but you miss out on other good things. After reading reviews on this, I decided to buy this one. Wow. He was impressed and it takes a lot, if he switches brands. Loved the weight and  how sturdy it was. Powerfully opened and closed and folded up to be very small. He has only used it once and was impressed!

Name: A high quality umbrella for a good price - can't wait for the rain!
Author: Joe
Review Text: While unfortunately I haven't had the opportunity yet to use, here are my impressions.  This umbrella seems extremely well made.  I especially like that it uses fiberglass coating material. My last two umbrellas broke as a result of rusting of the umbrella structure so am quite hopeful that this one will do better.  I personally could have wished for a slightly larger canopy and base/handle, but this is large enough for one person.

Name: I am sure it would be fine on a day that there was a small rainfall ...
Author: Scott Flipse
Review Text: I purchased this umbrella based on the positive reviews and the products description.  If you are looking for a durable umbrella, this is not the umbrella for you!  I am sure it would be fine on a day that there was a small rainfall with no wind.  Simply put, my umbrella broke after its first use with just a moderate amount of rain and wind.  I proceeded to throw the umbrella in the trash can!  DO NOT purchase this product if you are looking  for an umbrella that has durability!

Name: I am very pleased with the travel umbrella that I purchased from you
Author: Charlotte A. Yanush
Review Text: I am very pleased with the travel umbrella that I purchased from you.  I can't wait for it to rain so that I can use it.I am a widow; and I am just starting to do some traveling after five years of staying at home.  So, I figured that I needed a nice travel umbrella.  This umbrella seems to be just what I will need.  It is small enough to put in my purse, or a tote bag.  It is easy to open and close.  I am so glad that I found it on Amazon.  I really like it.

Name: Best umbrella I've ever had
Author: Tyler S.
Review Text: Absolutely love this umbrella. After having my last one get caught in the window and torn to pieces by flipping inside out, I bought this one. Works great! Love the auto-opening feature at the press of a button, and I have had this flip inside out from wind multiple times, and it is back to normal with the push of the button. My only suggestion is make sure you let it dry completely before closing it up and putting it back in the bag. I put it in the bag one time at work and the next time I got it out, the metal was starting to rust in some spots.

Name: Great Product
Author: GPH
Review Text: I live in the Pacific Northwest and have had many opportunities to use this umbrella in heavy rain and strong winds and it worked great.  I know for a fact that my previous umbrellas would have failed under these conditions.  My wife was so impressed with the quality and sturdiness of the umbrella she asked me to buy four more and replace all of our old umbrellas.  I now have this umbrella in all our vehicles and with our travel gear.

Name: Breaks quickly and LEAKS. THE WORST.
Author: chickolee
Review Text: WORST umbrella ever. I know there's a lifetime warranty, but I don't even want a replacement. I live in California, and it worked fine for a few times, but the closing mechanism broke 3 months in and wouldn't stay closed (unless I used the side flap). I brought it to Orlando (cause I realized it was the only umbrella I had), got caught in a downpour waiting in line for a ride at Disney World, and this POS umbrella was LEAKING. 10 min later I'm just as wet as someone without an umbrella. Threw it away immediately.

Name: This umbrella is great. Opens and closes with the click of a ...
Author: Bruce
Review Text: This umbrella is great.  Opens and closes with the click of a button, is very sturdy, and can stand up to the wind here in San Francisco.  It's small and light weight, making it very convenient.  Also, customer service is great!  I lost the slip cover after two years.  They are replacing it for me at no charge!  Next Christmas everyone's getting Repel umbrellas!

Name: ...it's small, lightweight, and well constructed. I'll be ready when it rains again.
Author: A.H.
Review Text: I've had this umbrella for a couple of days now. We haven't had any rainy weather yet, but I'll be ready with this umbrella when it does rain.. The umbrella opens and closes with a push of a button. It is constructed with 9 ribs that looks like it can withstand fairly strong winds. I haven't had a chance to test it out in windy conditions yet, but I think it would survive better than my other umbrella that has 6 ribs. I usually have to keep a close eye on my 6 ribbed umbrella when it's windy to prevent it from turning inside out. With this umbrella, I might not have to be as vigilant. It is light-weight and small. It's very easy to carry around. I've used a large umbrella in the past. I prefer small umbrella like this one that I can carry around with ease. To summarize: it's small, lightweight, and well constructed. I'll be ready when it rains again.

Name: Great Umbrella AND Great Customer Service!
Author: tracyamiller
Review Text: I bought several of these for Christmas gifts, and also one for myself. :)Not only am I impressed with the quality, I am very appreciative of the personal customer service when I had a delayed delivery. Although this delay was a mail carrier issue, a support member kept in touch until it was resolved.This will be my go-to umbrella which I plan on employing and enjoying for years!

Name: "It's just an umbrella" I thought to myself
Author: Jeffrey Leung
Review Text: After my old umbrella was destroyed by gust of wind, I was prompted to search for a new umbrella.  I searched on Amazon, and the first thing that appeared on the search result was Repel Easy Touch Umbrella. The price of roughly $25 was an instant turn off.  The idea of paying more than $15 for an umbrella was absurd!  However, the features of having "Dupont Teflon technology", "9 reinforced fiberglass ribs", and "Auto open/close" made me reconsider.When my package had arrived, I needed to test this umbrella.  "What makes this so good?" I wondered to myself.  I pushed the button and poof, the umbrella sprang opened.  My eyes opened wide.  "What is this magic?" I said out loud. I pushed the button once more, and the umbrella closed as promised in the advertisement.  I giggled and my eyes sparked; I had to share this magical contraption with my friends.On the following day, it was expected to rain.  I've never been so excited for rain in my entire life.  I arranged to meet my friends for dinner.  I had to bring this umbrella, and even did my rain dance to ensure it would rain that night.  When I had arrived at the restaurant, I met my friends, including a girl who I have never met before.  However, it wasn't raining.  I was deeply saddened, yet I still carried the umbrella with me - ready for the moment. After filling out bellies, we proceeded to the exit.  Outside, it was raining...no... it was pouring cats and dogs.  I had the biggest grin on my face, and I stood up straight and proudly push the button.  The umbrella sprang to life, everyone looked up in amazement.  I have never felt more admired than I ever had before.  My friends looked at me, demanding to know where they could buy this umbrella.Fortunately, the girl whom I had mentioned, looked at me with her large eyes.  She wanted to learn more about this umbrella, and we exchanged contacts.Thank you Repel Easy Touch Umbrella for getting me a phone number.Oh and Thanks for keeping me dry

Name: Great compact umbrella
Author: Dash V
Review Text: Great compact umbrella. The auto open/close works quite nicely. Plan to keep this in my car, or take in the side pocket of my laptop backpack for those rain days at work. I used to keep a much smaller one in the car for those jobs, and although it's tiny compact size was really convenient, it was useless when it was windy, and only kept you partly dry. This one should solve those problems!

Name: Not lightweight.  Other than that a great umbrella
Author: Joan in Brooklyn
Review Text: This is a great umbrella but its NOT lightweight at all.  I lost my "titanium" one finally after a few years.  This one is strong, opens well, closes well but not light weight.

Name: I like this a lot more than the others.
Author: Pat
Review Text: This umbrella kicks the pants off other travel umbrellas. I don't always enthuse about products, but I've had a lot of travel umbrellas that get messed up almost immediately. This is slightly larger than most, and sturdier. But what you pay in terms of size and cost you get back in terms of it actually working reliably. Only annoying thing is that when you collapse it you have to fold it all the way in to re-set the spring, or else you can't get it to open completely again. I consider that a small annoyance for the reliability.

Name: Life saver in those unexpected moments of rain and downpour!
Author: Flenn
Review Text: Have had it for months now and what a life saver! I travel a lot so I keep this tucked in my briefcase for those "moments of unexpected downpour" Well let me tell you it happens and this thing springs into action (pun intended) and is compact and light but large and strong! Highly recommend. It never leaks and dries out super fast. For 21 bucks on PrimeåÊRepel Easy Touch Umbrella DuPont Teflon Travel Umbrella, Blackyou won't be sorry!

Name: The handle felt great and umbrella felt sturdy otherwise
Author: Randy L
Review Text: Our umbrella failed after only a few users (3 times maybe).  The button no longer ejects or close the umbrella.  The handle felt great and umbrella felt sturdy otherwise.  Looking to see how and if we can get warranty replacement.  It's less than two months ownership!Update:  The seller is quick and swift to offer replacement. Always appreciative when they stand behind their product.

Name: Keeps me dry
Author: Chris B.
Review Text: I truly love the umbrella.  Opens and closes easily and looks great.  The design isn't a typical circular shape as it slopes down and outward keeping water and snow away from the body and especially the feet.  Durable as it holds up well to stronger winds and heavy snow.  I use it walking around my college campus and it protects my backpack which has electronics and electronic cords and I walk with my phone out and I don't have to worry about it getting wet.  Recommend to anyone.

Name: I ordered this umbrella because it has good reviews and has a good price
Author: byl5
Review Text: I ordered this umbrella because it has good reviews and has a good price. The product I received was defective (the button would not respond), but I contacted the company about the problem and they immediately sent a replacement. The replacement works as it should and I have to say that it is amazing. The umbrella opens instantly with a press of a button and has a very large canopy. It's also quite easy to collapse and wrap up for storage. The material seems quite strong, although I haven't used it for very long, and dries off pretty fast. The one bad thing (somewhat) I would mention is that it does still flip inside out easily when it is windy like most umbrellas. Overall though, the umbrella, the company, and the price are all fantastic.

Name: Product quality and customer service.
Author: AntMan
Review Text: Bought the umbrella about 2 years ago, and used it primarily for traveling to windy places - works excellent.  However, about 2 weeks ago, when trying to pack for our next trip, we found the umbrella does not open all the way.  I search online and email Repel regarding my problem; and within minutes, got a response back.  After providing additional Amazon order info, I was emailed a tracking number for a brand new umbrella (which has since been delivered).  Their customer service is unbelievable, and the way they stand behind their product is simply amazing.

Name: Rusted & broke
Author: Roberto C Tirado
Review Text: the few metal parts in the vanes rust.the plastic vanes break easily.umbrella did not last the year.it opens nicely but the canopy parts are not made to last. not worth my money.

Name: This is a very nice umbrella. It opens and closes easily and feels ...
Author: A Grandmother
Review Text: This is a very nice umbrella.  It opens and closes easily and feels secure.  I would like to have one a bit larger in diameter, but this is a travel umbrella and collapses to a size that will be easy to travel with as well as carry around town.  The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is that I really do like it, but I don't love it.  Have now ordered two.

Name: As good as a $6 drugstore umbrella
Author: Melanie Avids
Review Text: Where is the amazing umbrella you all wrote reviews about? The one I received is identical to the crappy ones I can buy at the drugstore for $6. It is slightly better than the ones you can buy on the street for $2, but it's not stronger, not more durable, not wind-resistant. I guess the price and the fake (?) reviews tricked me into thinking I was buying a quality item.

Name: Best Umbrellas We've Ever Owned
Author: Vista2020
Review Text: Amazing umbrellas! They are very compact so it is easy to store them in a carry bag. The automatic open/close feature is particularly handy so you can use it with one hand. The frame is sturdier than any other umbrella that I've ever used. The water repels off of the silicon surface so it never really seems wet when you get inside. We are very happy with both umbrellas that we purchased. Thank you!

Name: Strong but leaks in heavy rain.
Author: waynetn
Review Text: Purchased this for use on a trip to Europe. The umbrella appears to be built very sturdily. In fact the spring is so strong that it makes closing the umbrella a little difficult. I haven't used it in strong winds and feel it will hold up well. My only complaint is that the first time I used the umbrella it started leaking through the material where it is supported by the "stringers" during a very heavy downpour in Italy. It wasn't leaking from just one or two spots but all over and in sufficient amounts that I was getting wet from the dripping. The umbrella performed well under less intense rain. I like it's compactness although it felt a little heavy for traveling especially when limited to 50 pound bags. Overall I'm happy with the umbrella.

Name: Very good umbrella
Author: starfox707
Review Text: The premium umbrella that will last. If you live in a rainy place and need a new umbrella then stop reading and just buy it. It is not a jumbo umbrella but a perfect one or two person one. It is amazingly built and works very well. Super easy to just shake most of the rain off of it when going indoors and will last for many more years.

Name: These seem more expensive than the umbrellas we usually buy but so many great reviews. After opening the umbrella you can tell ...
Author: GY
Review Text: I want to prepare for the upcoming rains so I purchased 4 of these so I can keep 2 for me and 2 for my wife.  It seems each year we are looking for umbrellas and never can find them.  These seem more expensive than the umbrellas we usually buy but so many great reviews.  After opening the umbrella you can tell the quality is much better than I am use to. I am satisfied and excited to start using them!

Name: Good Umbrella....BUT
Author: MOE III
Review Text: Small, 36 inches diameter (not as claimed by another reviewer 42 inches), short, not worth $22.

Name: Excellent value, well made
Author: NY Ray
Review Text: I waited until a good rain to review this item. The handle is solid with a ridged surface which provides a firm grip. The release action is smooth and quick. The metal frame is sturdy. The umbrella itself has a stylish, angular curve. It packs easily and fits well in my backpack. The case is a nice extra. I am very pleased. UPDATE. I gave my original Repel umbrella to my daughter and bought a replacement.

Name: A-Okay, But Not Really Windproof
Author: Sean Maguire
Review Text: Based on the thousands of wonderful reviews, I was expecting to really love this umbrella. Don't get me wrong, I DO like it, but love would definitely be too strong. I agree that this umbrella is lightweight, compact, and does the job, but it wasn't as sturdy as I'd hoped in the wind. The umbrella did not turn inside out or anything like that, but it definitely didn't live up to the "windproof" claim.

Name: It's small BUT VERY STRONG!  I like it so much that I ended up buying 3 more for my friends.  Mom and sisters bought one as well
Author: Mel Fernandez
Review Text: This is a wonderful product.  First of all, it came exactly as advertised.  Second the product arrived way earlier than the expected time.  It's small BUT VERY STRONG!  I like it so much that I ended up buying 3 more for my friends.  Then when my Mom and sisters saw and used it, they ended up getting their own as well.  It seems so unassuming, but it's so strong and high quality.

Name: It Is Heavy
Author: Henry Gillespie
Review Text: I've barely used this but it seems to work well. Exercising its various open-closing functions showed me how useful they would be and prompted me to give it four rather than three stars. However it is heavy. Its weight doesn't make it easy to carry along unless one knows it really will be needed. I may give it another star after more use.--Henry Gillespie

Name: Better Than The Kisha Umbrella, I'll Tell You That Much! (-_-)
Author: Morhy S.
Review Text: I had to wait for heavy rain to pour in NYC to see the efficiency of the umbrella. I have to say, it's effective. It's compact and I'm pretty confident that I don't have to worry about the umbrella breaking apart. I bought this umbrella under the review of other users using it and I steadfastly took that chance because my previous umbrella broke under the intense rain despite the video showing the strength and resilience during intense winds on YouTube (I'm talking about the Kisha Umbrella of course). Adding to that, this umbrella has lifetime warranty. That's cool. Overall, I can see myself using this umbrella from this point on. 5/5 stars, indeed.

Name: I do like the fact that it opens when you push the ...
Author: Carol
Review Text: åÊHaven't had to use this yet but I'm traveling to Florida and the weather is calling for rain all week. I do like the fact that it opens when you push the button,  but it also closes when you push it.  All you have to do is push the handle back in!

Name: The automatic opener works great but if you are carrying other items (travel mug
Author: AMD
Review Text: Only used it one time so far. Not sure if the price tag is worth it. It didn't seem much sturdier than umbrellas I have purchased for a lot less. The automatic opener works great but if you are carrying other items (travel mug, lunch tote, commuter pass) the umbrella is difficult to close. I had to set stuff down in order to close the umbrella. This makes it very awkward when you are trying to navigate on public transportation.

Name: Can't Wait to Use It (and now that I did, happ that I have it)
Author: Steamboat Willie
Review Text: Just received both umbrellas in perfect shape.  They appear quite sturdy and well-made in a compact size.  The size makes it easy to keep it in my briefbag for quick access.  The lifetime guarantee is big plus especially given the very reasonable price.  No rain in the forecast here, but will have a chance to use it in other cities and will update when I do. Holding off on the final star pending usage.An update:This umbrella really lives up to the claims! Truly repels water and is sturdy in strong wind gusts!  Purchased a third one for the car (first is in my briefcase, gave the other away).

Name: Excellent quality. Snaps open very quickly which was important ...
Author: Amazon Customer
Review Text: Excellent quality.  Snaps open very quickly which was important to me.  I cant tell you how irritating it is to open your car door while it is raining only to have an umbrella that opens in slow motion.  This umbrella will solve that problem for me.  It is raining here today so will update my review once I have had a chance to use it in rainy weather.Update:  This umbrella saved me from a bad injury.  It was raining and as I was getting out of my car I opened the umbrella, walked two steps to go into the store and stepped in a pot hole in the store parking lot.  I immediately fell forward, however, because I was holding the umbrella, it hit the ground first, I fell on the umbrella with my stomach, and it broke my fall causing me to roll sideways instead of face first in the concrete.  This umbrella was so sturdy, it bent only slightly however it bent enough that I had to replace it.  The store manager did pay for the replacement of my umbrella.  Cant say enough good things about this product.

Name: It's a nice umbrella, however
Author: Jasenmase
Review Text: It's a nice umbrella, however, the "windproof" part is a little misleading. Mine blew every which way during a wind/rain storm as with every other umbrella I've used. It does seem to be of better build quality though, so I definitely don't regret my purchase.

Name: I'm impressed
Author: Dave4047
Review Text: I received mine today and put it through its paces a few times. Works as advertised. Some have reported it being hard to push the shaft closed. Mine works easily. I was impressed enough to order a second one just now. Only thing I would ask them to change was the way it's shipped. We all know how unreliable the post office is I sure wouldn't send it in a large envelope. Though mine came through fine I have had a few things that didn't.

Name: Gift.
Author: rusty90
Review Text: Untested .bought for gift. If it fails will let everyone know. Update #1 well it did not break but is unstable handle is wonky and not a good feeling.  If it rains again will update.update#2 seller was great sent me new umbrella works much better. thank you.

Name: I don't like doing reviews
Author: melissa
Review Text: If I could give this product a 100 stars I would. I don't like doing reviews, but this product was so good I had to do something. I believe that when you make something with love . You are taking something you made from the heart and passing it on. I thank you for this umbrella, the quality of this umbrella ,and the vip service. I pray everyone who reads and are tired of store brought umbrellas try this one.

Name: Well Worth the Extra Cost
Author: Gary Burns
Review Text: I accidentally left my old umbrella in a pub in Ireland, so I poured over the reviews and bought this one despite a price higher than many of the others available through Amazon. I am glad that I did. I have used it during several of the torrential downpours that are common here in Florida, and during normal rain shower activity. It handles both types of storm well. I have never had an umbrella with an auto close feature, and was skeptical about its utility, but I have found that this feature comes in handy when you are carrying packages and arrive at your car with only one hand free. I also appreciate how quickly the umbrella dries out after use. This umbrella appears to be well crafted, and I expect to get many years of use out of it, if I don't lose it first! I like it so much that I have just ordered another one to keep in my car.

Name: Really great Umbrella
Author: Aly
Review Text: Can't attest to the longevity but it opens/closes easily, repels water so that it stays dry and when you wrap the secure band around, it fits perfectly without having to stretch it or worry about it coming undone. Overall highly satisfied. It can also fit in my purse.Edit: I've had this for a few months now and it comes in really handy in Florida rainstorms. I still love it and it's held up well.

Name: Not tough against winds
Author: Charlie
Review Text: The first time I used it, it turns inside-out.  Bad experiences‰ÛÜ-update feb 23 2017I am surprise after about 8months later. Seller is offer me a full refund. I am going to add a star to 4 stars

Name: A great all purpose umbrella
Author: Norman
Review Text: I purchased this product last November after recently moving to Oregon. Needless to say I was going to see more than my fair share of rain and I needed a durable, dependable umbrella which I found in this product. The umbrella does a great job repelling water and quickly dries once you've been through a decent downpour. I am very satisfied with this product and I'm planning to get another one to leave in my car so I'll always have one on standby.

Name: Great little umbrella.
Author: J. C.
Review Text: Great little umbrella, nice build quality.Press the button once and it extends and opens up.Press the button again and the top part collapses.Making putting it in the car when its raining much easier.Comes with a lifetime warranty.

Name: As expected
Author: Curious4
Review Text: This umbrella works very well. When you press the button, it opens pretty forcefully so you need to be careful and make sure it's not pointed at anyone. When you press the button to close, it closes the top part and you have to push it in to close all the way. It takes a little bit of effort to push it in but it works well overall.

Name: Small and a bit on the heavy side
Author: v_dogg12
Review Text: We don't get a lot of rain here in South Texas so I haven't had the opportunity to test out the umbrella. It was purchased to use on an overseas trip, but it's a heavy little umbrella. Hopefully that speaks to the quality and I've decided to keep it though I'll be looking for a lighter option for the trip.

Name: Good quality and compact.
Author: Bookreader
Review Text: I ordered this umbrella for my husband.  He has not had an opportunity to use it yet but he is very happy with the quality and the way it opens and closes with the push of a button.  We will be traveling by plane soon and this will fit nicely in the suitcase.  Thank you.

Name: Great Design
Author: JP
Review Text: This umbrella appears to be of solid construction. I have not used it yet but after years of buying umbrellas in grocery and convenience stores you can tell the difference in the quality. The open and close button is convenient. There is one extra rib which adds a noticeable amount of strength. Based on the umbrellas I used to own this one should last a long time!

Name: Good Quality Umbrella...a bit difficult to close.
Author: Wishing for a tree
Review Text: WOW!  Nice quality umbrella.  I've always purchased lower quality umbrellas...so this was a nice surprise.I find it a bit difficult to close.  You have to push down from the top with quite a bit of strength.  But it is a solid umbrella.  It has been raining here for weeks...so I'm quite happy to have this in hand.

Name: Not worth the $20 asking price.
Author: Giovanni Molina
Review Text: I haven't had a good experience with this umbrella so far. The first one I received had a visible hole in the fabric, and later one of the legs broke very easily as they are very thing. I got a replacement free of charge, but the fabric just seems to be too thin and frail and I'm expecting it to break soon as well. Not worth the $20 asking price.

Name: Great product
Author: Allan J
Review Text: Umbrella is very well made. The extra ribs give it a lot of stability. Opening it up is a breeze and it is large enough to keep you dry. I like the idea of the Teflon coating. Water runs off it much easier than an ordinary umbrella.

Name: This umbrella works quite well‰ÛÓit's easy to activate and compact
Author: Amazon Customer
Review Text: This umbrella works quite well‰ÛÓit's easy to activate and compact. The only issue I have is that it's TOO compact. It's quite small and for someone like me who usually has a pack on, it's not going to keep me fully dry. I feel like a giant when using it. If it was a bit larger, it would have a full five-star review from me.

Name: Aweseome umbrella - and awesome customer service!!
Author: Will Prince
Review Text: Ordered this umbrella after checking out several others on Amazon while looking for a travel umbrella I can put in my backpack as I prepare for a Europe trip. Product was delivered on time and as promised. Umbrella appears to be of good quality - sturdy, Teflon coated, 9 ribbed as described, auto open / close function operates smoothly. Of PRIME importance to me was that the owner reached out to me after the sale to make sure I had received the product and that there were no problems with it. There weren't, but the fact they took the time to reach out to me impressed me and I would definitely recommend them and I would definitely do business with them again!

Name: The umbrella has good instructions on how to open and close the umbrella
Author: D. Shuford
Review Text: The umbrella has good instructions on how to open and close the umbrella.  I finally resorted to reading the directions, on how to close it, which are clear and simple.  It's an excellent umbrella. - easy to open and close --and effective in keeping me dry. You'll be glad to have it.

Name: Goo solid umbrella, appears to be high quality
Author: Lady Tx
Review Text: I ordered two of these. They are good solid umbrellas. I usually pick up the $10-15 umbrellas at the super store or mall and they never last. I have high hopes fo these. I can tell they are much better quality. The only issue i had was I ordered a black one and they sent navy; wasn't worth the hassle of returning it.

Name: My ella, ella, ella...
Author: Ryan Mattern
Review Text: Hands down best mini umbrella I have ever owned. Arrived in great condition. Product performs as listed in the description. My favorite feature is the second button push collapses the umbrella, you just have to push down for carry mode. Overall great product from a very professional company

Name: Pleasantly Surprised
Author: Stuart Clubb
Review Text: Fairly compact, lightweight and easy to open and close. I have yet to experience a downpour with it, but it looks like it will be up to the job.I did like that the sleeve for it is big enough such that it's not a tight squeeze to get the umbrella back in after use

Name: Opens like a dream !
Author: Nurse 1
Review Text: Was able to use this umbrella the next day . Very windy and raining . At first the wind caught the umbrella and I thought here we go... It‰Ûªs broke . BUT I was able to close the umbrella and reopen it without any difficulty . Was impressed that it didn‰Ûªt bend . Works great !!!

Name: _Ù÷I tried several other brands that was a big flop_Ù÷ÙI am pleased to tell you that I am very very happy ...
Author: Brenda Smith
Review Text: I was anxious to see if your product was as described when my picky fingers search for a replacement umbrella to replace my lil green machine of 6 years! _Ù÷I tried several other brands that was a big flop_Ù÷ÙI am pleased to tell you that I am very very happy with my umbrella!! I love to give another review in 1 year span and a 5 year span! If you only knew me, you would shout with my review because I am very picky and if I love a product, it's a winner!!_Ù÷ä_Ù÷ä

Name: Disappointing
Author: Denny Ewell
Review Text: The handle on this umbrella is very small and does not fit comfortably in a mans hand.  It's impossible to tell this before you buy it, so if you want a full size handle find something else.

Name: Sturdy and dries quickly
Author: Matt
Review Text: I've used this in the rain a few times now its a little small for me but very sturdy hasn't flipped inside out or buckled at all and the Teflon coating makes it shake dry in a few seconds

Name: Good Umbrella
Author: Kyle Bunkers
Review Text: The umbrella is very good at keeping the rain off you.  It is sturdily built, and looks like it will last a long time.  My only complaint is that the grip could be more ergonomic and larger.  Otherwise, the button works well, and it is still quite easy to hold.

Name: High quality and reasonably priced! Definitely happy w/ purchase.
Author: Jen
Review Text: My only suggestion to make it better is that the case for the umbrella needs to be slightly larger. After the first time taking the umbrella out and opening/closing it, it took two of us to get it back into the sleeve/case.Overall though, thoroughly impressed with the overall quality v. price of the umbrella! I have confidence that this will last us a long time, but it is good to know that there is a lifetime replacement guarantee, just in case.

Name: Good!
Author: JVII
Review Text: The undercarriage is beefier than your standard umbrella, although the cloth should have slits to let the wind pass through. We will see if it can stand up to strong winds, but the extra sturdy metal should prove better than a standard umbrella. Easy up and down and not very heavy.

Name: nice fast deployment of the umbrella
Author: M J
Review Text: Compact, nice fast deployment of the umbrella. No defects upon receipt. I still have to use it outside before I see how durable it is.  They need to send these assessment requests some time after so people can get a chance to use the product. If you hear nothing back, all is well!

Name: High quality
Author: Robert Lincoln
Review Text: Very well made umbrella, high quality.  Item is exactly as described.  It's a little heavy, but I'm sure no heavier than other 12 inch umbrellas.  I was looking for something on the order of 7 inches, and I just can't find them.  So for a 12 inch umbrella, this seems to be the one.

Name: One hand open and close
Author: BobGP
Review Text: Nice  compact and sturdy umbrella.  I love the fact you can both open and close it with only one hand.  The crappy weather we've had here lately has given my plenty of time to try it out ;)

Name: Difficult to Close & Brakes Fairly Quickly
Author: Amazon Customer
Review Text: Like some of the other reviewers on here, I had some substantial trouble closing this umbrella after a few uses. This resulted in me slowly breaking the umbrella after a few months of use trying to force it to close. I wouldn't recommend this umbrella to anyone, its just a generic travel umbrella.

Name: and the umbrella itself did a great job of keeping the freezing rain/rain off of body
Author: Matthew S. Steele
Review Text: My new Upper Echelon Products umbrella was received in a very timely manner. The product itself is well made and I had to use it the very day I received it, and the umbrella itself did a great job of keeping the freezing rain/rain off of body. I will be doing business with this company again. Shout out to Amazon, thanks!Matthew

Name: Works as described. Love it!
Author: Anthony Beauregard
Review Text: I push a button and it opens. I push the same button again and it closes. Everything I could ask.I had a question and Upper Echelon Products responded quickly and helped me with questions. Great product from a great seller.

Name: Excellent travel umbrella.
Author: Bruce Frier
Review Text: Compact and perfect for travel. It covers more effectively than most such umbrellas, although I've not yet tested it on a windy day. But it is an essential addition to my suitcase.

Name: Perhaps the best umbrella I've used
Author: Tim J
Review Text: Perhaps the best umbrella I've used. I am short(er) and the shaft length is perfect. Due to the material, when entering a building you can give it a few good shakes and get nearly all of the water off before rolling it up.

Name: Love it!!
Author: diegoms97
Review Text: I love it! It feels sturdy and seems like the best compact umbrella I have ever had!** Regardless, I will update this review after testing the umbrella in real world conditions.After testing the umbrella, I can easily say that it is fantastic! Super convenient!

Name: High Quality Product
Author: Aaron S.
Review Text: Seems like a very well made umbrella. You can feel the quality in the weight of it. Only got to use it 3 times but once was in high winds and it performed flawlessly. Would highly recommend to anybody looking for compact umbrella

Name: ... of buying umbrella after umbrella for them to just easily break due to the wind
Author: Amazon Customer
Review Text: I was tired of buying umbrella after umbrella for them to just easily break due to the wind. So I finally bought the Repel and loved it.
